content: The following lists events that happened during **(/wiki/1954) in [Colony of Singapore](/wiki/Colony_of_Singapore)**. ## Incumbents - [Governor](/wiki/List_of_Governors_of_Singapore): Sir [John Fearns Nicoll](/wiki/John_Fearns_Nicoll) - [Colonial Secretary](/wiki/List_of_Chief_Secretaries_of_Singapore): Sir [Wiiliam Goode](/wiki/William_Allmond_Codrington_Goode) ## Events ### February - 6 February – 300 [Straits Times](/wiki/The_Straits_Times) printing employees when on strike, resulting in [The Sunday Times](/wiki/The_Sunday_Times_(Singapore)) not being published the following day. - 22 February – [Rendel Commission's](/wiki/Constitution_of_Singapore) recommendations were unveiled to the public. It proposed changes to the constitution, which took effect on 8 February 1955. ### May - 13 May – The [National Service riots](/wiki/1954_National_Service_riots) took place in Singapore after a peaceful demonstration turned violent. ### August - 21 August – The [Singapore Labour Front](/wiki/Labour_Front) (LF) was founded. ### October - 27 October – [Singapore Polytechnic](/wiki/Singapore_Polytechnic) was founded as the first polytechnic in Singapore. ### November - 21 November – The [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party) (PAP) was founded. ## Births - 6 January – [Ong Keng Yong](/wiki/Ong_Keng_Yong), diplomat. - 12 February – [Tan Jee Say](/wiki/Tan_Jee_Say), politician and former public servant. - 9 April – [Lim Hng Kiang](/wiki/Lim_Hng_Kiang), former politician. - 24 April – [Belinda Ang](/wiki/Belinda_Ang), judge of the Court of Appeal. - 9 May – [Ho Peng Kee](/wiki/Ho_Peng_Kee), legal academic and former politician. - 10 July – [Lim Kay Tong](/wiki/Lim_Kay_Tong), film, television and stage actor. - 13 July – [Lim Swee Say](/wiki/Lim_Swee_Say), former politician. - 23 August – [Halimah Yacob](/wiki/Halimah_Yacob), 8th [President of Singapore](/wiki/President_of_Singapore). - 13 September – [George Yeo](/wiki/George_Yeo), former politician. - 22 September – [Marcus Chin](/wiki/Marcus_Chin), actor. - 29 November – [Koo Tsai Kee](/wiki/Koo_Tsai_Kee), associate professor and former politician. - 27 December – [Teo Chee Hean](/wiki/Teo_Chee_Hean), [Senior Minister of Singapore](/wiki/Senior_Minister_of_Singapore). ## Deaths - 4 September – [Aw Boon Haw](/wiki/Aw_Boon_Haw), entrepreneur and philanthropist best known as founder of [Tiger Balm](/wiki/Tiger_Balm) (b. 1882). - 28 September – George Parbury, pre-war municipal commissioner (b. 1876). - 9 December – [Charles Paglar](/wiki/Charles_Joseph_Pemberton_Paglar), surgeon, gynaecologist, politician, philanthropist and leader of the [Eurasian Community of Singapore](/wiki/Eurasian_Singaporeans) (b. 1894). -
